intro: Chondrilla brevirostris, commonly known as the short-beaked chondrilla, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces small, yellowish-green composite flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Chondrilla brevirostris is often found in rocky soils and is considered a valuable component of local ecosystems.
